skill.name: Tooling Setup Best Practices
skill.description: This approach describes best practices for setting up, configuring, and maintaining development tooling to support agent-augmented development. It provides a framework for tool selection, configura...

principles.title: Tool Selection Rigor
principles.description: Choose tools based on measurable criteria: usage frequency, performance improvement, maintenance activity, and security posture.

principles.title: Configuration Consistency
principles.description: Establish reproducible environments through version pinning, platform-aware setup scripts, and documented configuration patterns.

principles.title: Proactive Maintenance
principles.description: Schedule regular reviews to update versions, audit security, assess performance, and align with evolving agent needs.

principles.title: Graceful Degradation
principles.description: Provide fallback strategies for every tool to ensure agents can operate even when preferred tools are unavailable.

principles.title: Documentation Discipline
principles.description: Keep setup instructions, troubleshooting guides, and version tables synchronized with actual tooling state.

when_to_use: Establishing a new development environment for agent-augmented work
Evaluating tools for addition to the standard toolkit
Configuring CI/CD environments for consistent agent execution
Troubleshooting tool availability or performance issues
Planning quarterly or annual tooling maintenance reviews
when_not_to_use: Working with experimental or one-off tools not intended for standardization
Setting up tools outside the agent execution context
Making temporary workarounds that shouldn't become precedents
